title: How to Steam Lobster
description:
Learn how to steam lobster with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Lobster

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to steam a lobster first place the live lobster on a cutting board place the tip of a chef's knife one inch 2.5 centimeters above the first striation and insert the knife straight down through the lobster move the blade down so it's parallel to the cutting board to humanely kill the lobster then set a steaming rack inside of a large pot fill the pot with 2 inches five centimeters of water and add one tablespoon 17 grams of salt bring the water to a boil then place the lobster on the steaming rack and cover the pot steam a 1 pound half a kilogram lobster for 14 minutes adding 3 minutes for each additional pound half a kilogram finally drain the lobster and serve with some melted butterto steam a lobster first place the live lobster on a cutting board place the tip of a chef's knife one inch 2.5 centimeters above the first striation and insert the knife straight down through the lobster move the blade down so it's parallel to the cutting board to humanely kill the lobster then set a steaming rack inside of a large pot fill the pot with 2 inches five centimeters of water and add one tablespoon 17 grams of salt bring the water to a boil then place the lobster on the steaming rack and cover the pot steam a 1 pound half a kilogram lobster for 14 minutes adding 3 minutes for each additional pound half a kilogram finally drain the lobster and serve with some melted butter

title: How to Store Fresh Green Beans
description:
This quick video will give you some tips on #howto store fresh green beans!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Store-Fresh-Green-Beans

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you need to store fresh green beans to use within a week use a sharp knife to carefully cut off the knobby ends of the beans do not wash the beans before you store them as the moisture can cause mold to form fold a paper towel and place it into a large resealable bag to absorb moisture then fill the bag with the green beans push as much air out of the bag as you can before you seal it wash the beans before you use themif you need to store fresh green beans to use within a week use a sharp knife to carefully cut off the knobby ends of the beans do not wash the beans before you store them as the moisture can cause mold to form fold a paper towel and place it into a large resealable bag to absorb moisture then fill the bag with the green beans push as much air out of the bag as you can before you seal it wash the beans before you use them

title: How to Store Fresh Rosemary
description:
Learn how to store fresh rosemary with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Store-Fresh-Rosemary

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to store fresh rosemary start by rinsing the springs in cool water and placing them on a paper towel to pat them dry then wrap the whole uncut springs in a damp paper towel to prevent them from drying out place the wrap springs in a ziploc bag or air tight container and write the date on the bag or container store the bag in the crisper drawer of the refrigerator and set the humidity in the drawer to high you can store the rosemary here for up to two weeks before it will begin to turn brown and loses freshnessto store fresh rosemary start by rinsing the springs in cool water and placing them on a paper towel to pat them dry then wrap the whole uncut springs in a damp paper towel to prevent them from drying out place the wrap springs in a ziploc bag or air tight container and write the date on the bag or container store the bag in the crisper drawer of the refrigerator and set the humidity in the drawer to high you can store the rosemary here for up to two weeks before it will begin to turn brown and loses freshness

title: How to Store Guacamole
description:
This quick video will give you some tips on #howto store guacamole!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Store-Guacamole

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to store guacamole first transfer it into an airtight container and pack it down with a spoon then pour a little bit of water or lime juice over the top since contact with the air will cause the guacamole to turn brown cover the container with plastic wrap before putting on the lid store the guacamole in the fridge for three to five daysto store guacamole first transfer it into an airtight container and pack it down with a spoon then pour a little bit of water or lime juice over the top since contact with the air will cause the guacamole to turn brown cover the container with plastic wrap before putting on the lid store the guacamole in the fridge for three to five days

title: How to Store Potatoes
description:
Learn How to Store Potatoes with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Store-Potatoes

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to store potatoes first place them in an open bag basket or other ventilated container since closed containers make potatoes spoil faster then store the potatoes in a cool dry dark place like a pantry or your basement don't keep raw potatoes in the fridge since the cold temperature can change how they taste stored this way potatoes will stay good for around one to two weeks for longer-term storage keep the potatoes at 45 and 55 degrees Fahrenheit 7 and 13 degrees Celsius where they'll stay good for up to 3 monthsto store potatoes first place them in an open bag basket or other ventilated container since closed containers make potatoes spoil faster then store the potatoes in a cool dry dark place like a pantry or your basement don't keep raw potatoes in the fridge since the cold temperature can change how they taste stored this way potatoes will stay good for around one to two weeks for longer-term storage keep the potatoes at 45 and 55 degrees Fahrenheit 7 and 13 degrees Celsius where they'll stay good for up to 3 months

subtitles: to wash lettuce use a knife to cut off the root in any wilted spots from the lettuce and cut out the core if you're using iceberg lettuce use your hands to separate the lettuce leaves then soak your lettuce in a bowl full of cold water swirling the lettuce around to loosen any dirt after about 10 minutes take the greens out of the bowl and shake any excess water off the leaves dry the lettuce by spinning it in a salad spinner or by patting the leaves dry with paper towels youto wash lettuce use a knife to cut off the root in any wilted spots from the lettuce and cut out the core if you're using iceberg lettuce use your hands to separate the lettuce leaves then soak your lettuce in a bowl full of cold water swirling the lettuce around to loosen any dirt after about 10 minutes take the greens out of the bowl and shake any excess water off the leaves dry the lettuce by spinning it in a salad spinner or by patting the leaves dry with paper towels you

title: How to Clean Eggs
description:
Learn how to clean eggs with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Eggs

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to clean eggs start by filling two bowls with warm water then add a few drops of dish soap into one of the bowls and a splash of vinegar or bleach to the other next dip each egg in the dish soap water and scrub it with your fingers or a scrub brush after you clean off the eggs dip them in the vinegar or bleach water and set them on a paper towel to dry once the eggs are dry transfer them to a carton and you're done youto clean eggs start by filling two bowls with warm water then add a few drops of dish soap into one of the bowls and a splash of vinegar or bleach to the other next dip each egg in the dish soap water and scrub it with your fingers or a scrub brush after you clean off the eggs dip them in the vinegar or bleach water and set them on a paper towel to dry once the eggs are dry transfer them to a carton and you're done you

title: How to Clean Strawberries
description:
Learn how to clean strawberries with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Strawberries

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to clean strawberries first fill a large bowl with four parts water and one part white vinegar place the strawberries in the vinegar solution and let them soak for 20 minutes then drain the strawberries into a colander and rinse them thoroughly with cool water rotate the strawberries in the colander while rinsing them so the water gets to all of the fruit finally pat the strawberries dry with paper towels for organic strawberries you can just rinse them off with cool water in a colander to clean them since they shouldn't have any pesticides on themto clean strawberries first fill a large bowl with four parts water and one part white vinegar place the strawberries in the vinegar solution and let them soak for 20 minutes then drain the strawberries into a colander and rinse them thoroughly with cool water rotate the strawberries in the colander while rinsing them so the water gets to all of the fruit finally pat the strawberries dry with paper towels for organic strawberries you can just rinse them off with cool water in a colander to clean them since they shouldn't have any pesticides on them

title: How to Cut a Papaya
description:
Learn How to Cut a Papaya with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Cut-a-Papaya

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to cut a papaya first cut the papaya in half lengthwise using a sharp chef's knife then scoop out all of the seeds in each half using a spoon and discard them place one of the halves skin side down on your cutting board and cut it into thick evenly spaced slices repeat with the other half now use your knife to cut the skin off of each slice you can leave the slices as they are or you can make evenly spaced cuts across them for bite size papaya pieces be sure to practice knife safetyto cut a papaya first cut the papaya in half lengthwise using a sharp chef's knife then scoop out all of the seeds in each half using a spoon and discard them place one of the halves skin side down on your cutting board and cut it into thick evenly spaced slices repeat with the other half now use your knife to cut the skin off of each slice you can leave the slices as they are or you can make evenly spaced cuts across them for bite size papaya pieces be sure to practice knife safety

description:

subtitles: to bake potatoes first scrub the potatoes and rinse them in cold water pat them dry and cut off any bruised or discolored spots then pierce the potatoes with a fork for faster cooking in an oven bake the potatoes at 425 degrees Fahrenheit 220 degrees Celsius for 45 to 60 minutes you also wrap them in aluminum foil to shorten your cooking time since it acts as a heat conductor for fast baked potatoes place the washed and Pierce potatoes in a microwave-safe dish cook for 5 minutes on each side and enjoyto bake potatoes first scrub the potatoes and rinse them in cold water pat them dry and cut off any bruised or discolored spots then pierce the potatoes with a fork for faster cooking in an oven bake the potatoes at 425 degrees Fahrenheit 220 degrees Celsius for 45 to 60 minutes you also wrap them in aluminum foil to shorten your cooking time since it acts as a heat conductor for fast baked potatoes place the washed and Pierce potatoes in a microwave-safe dish cook for 5 minutes on each side and enjoy

title: How do you become an executive chef? | wikiHow Asks Michelin Star rated chef Alex Hong
description:
wikiHow spent a day in the life of executive chef Alex Hong, and learned what it takes to become Michelin Star rated. Alex is a co-owner of Sorrel restaurant in San Francisco, CA.
Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Become-a-Chef
---
wikiHow Expert Alex Hong is the Executive Chef and owner of Sorrel, a New American restaurant in San Francisco. He has been working in restaurants for over ten years. Alex is a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, and has worked in the kitchens of Jean-Georges and Quince, both Michelin-starred restaurants.
Learn more: https://www.sorrelrestaurant.com/

---
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/

---

title: How to Blanch Cauliflower
description:
Learn how to blanch cauliflower with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Blanch-Cauliflower

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to blanch cauliflower first bring a large pot of water to a boil and fill a bowl with water and ice cut the cauliflower up into florets then add the florets to the boiling water let the florets cook for three minutes drain the florets in a colander and immediately transfer them to the bowl of ice water so they stop cooking finally drain the cauliflower in the colander and dry the florets with a dish towel you can store your blanched cauliflower in an airtight container in the fridge for up to five days or in the freezer for up to six monthsto blanch cauliflower first bring a large pot of water to a boil and fill a bowl with water and ice cut the cauliflower up into florets then add the florets to the boiling water let the florets cook for three minutes drain the florets in a colander and immediately transfer them to the bowl of ice water so they stop cooking finally drain the cauliflower in the colander and dry the florets with a dish towel you can store your blanched cauliflower in an airtight container in the fridge for up to five days or in the freezer for up to six months
